title: Lang's theorem
summary: In algebraic geometry, Lang's theorem, introduced by Serge Lang, states: if G is a connected smooth algebraic group over a finite field F q {\displaystyle \mathbf {F} _{q}} , then, writing σ : G → G , x ↦ x q {\displaystyle \sigma :G\to G,\,x\mapsto x^{q}} for the Frobenius, the morphism of varieties
